|<details><summary>32 files</summary> `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.QuadraticModuleCat.Symmetric` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.PosDef` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.ExteriorAlgebra.Grading` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Prod` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Conjugation` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.QuadraticModuleCat` `Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.LineDeriv.QuadraticMap` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.QuadraticModuleCat.Monoidal` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Star` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Real` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Equivs` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Fold` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Complex` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Even` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Inversion` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Grading` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Basic` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.CategoryTheory` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.IsometryEquiv` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.LDL` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.SchurComplement` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Isometry` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.EvenEquiv` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.BaseChange` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.TensorProduct` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Contraction` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.ExteriorAlgebra.OfAlternating` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.CliffordAlgebra.Prod` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.TensorProduct.Isometries` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.ExteriorAlgebra.Basic` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Dual`</details>|5|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ map_sum`
`+ map_sum'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The eventual motivation here is something like
```lean
noncomputable def QuadraticForm.toTriMatrix {Î¹ R M} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
    (Q : QuadraticForm R M) (bm : Basis Î¹ R M) [LinearOrder Î¹] : Matrix Î¹ Î¹ R :=
  Matrix.of fun i j =>
    ltByCases i j
        (fun _ => polar Q (bm i) (bm j))
        (fun _ => Q (bm i))
        (fun _ => 0)


theorem QuadraticForm.toTriMatrix_mul  {Î¹ R M} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
    (Q : QuadraticForm R M) (bm : Basis Î¹ R M) [LinearOrder Î¹] [Fintype Î¹] :
    (Matrix.toBilin bm (Q.toTriMatrix bm)).toQuadraticForm = Q := sorry
```
where the `ltByCases` is materializing the sum over `sym2`.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14212~~

!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c80ac853-5dac-4f47-9c62-f05682002223) for commit d4b1367be0e29c3f164a488150805ed8200212fc.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0bb5601d-6e68-414a-af65-f2f6b8a542a4/to/c80ac853-5dac-4f47-9c62-f05682002223) against commit 88432aee6f54a4afba8b00bed541e45dad90ed25.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9972264730/job/27555154818)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9972264730/job/27555154524)
Looks otherwise good to me
Looks otherwise good to me
@YaelDillies, do you know if we have a spelling of this that doesn't need `DecidableEq Î¹`? Obviously my lemma below avoids it, but at the expense of needing subtraction!

A bit of a hack, but you can write that as 
```suggestion
      âˆ‘ ij in (s.powerset.slice 2).attach.map
        âŸ¨fun t â†¦ (Sym2.equivSym _).symm âŸ¨t.1.1, (mem_slice.1 t.2).2âŸ©,
          (Sym2.equivSym _).symm.injective.comp sorry /- good luck -/âŸ©,
```
I think I'd prefer to keep the `DecidableEq` in that case!
If you want to be computationally efficient, then you need to implement `List.subDiagonal` and use it to define `Finset.sym2OffDiagonal`. For now, I suggest that we use `DecidableEq`.
List.subDiagonal exists as `List.diagM` I think.

nit
```suggestion
        Sym2.lift âŸ¨fun i j => polar Q (f i) (f j), fun _ _ => polar_comm ..âŸ© ij := by
```
I don't really find this an improvement, it makes more work for the reader and the elaborator

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: quadratic forms applied to sums decompose into quadratic and bilinear parts
